items.title: Ship Monaco Editor with only ESM support

labels.name: plan-item
labels.description: VS Code - planned item for upcoming

items.body:
We should release a fresh version of the Monaco Editor.

Due to VS Code's migration to ESM, the release will no longer contain the AMD variant. We need to make sure this is clearly communicated in the changelog. The only thing the ESM variant was missing before vs the AMD variant was out-of-the-box support for localization, so we should make sure to add examples and document how localization can be exercised by a consumer.

items.title: Claude Model Missing from GitHub Copilot Model Dropdown List
items.body:
Type: Bug In the GitHub Copilot extension for VS Code, the Claude model is no longer visible in the model selection dropdown. This issue prevents users from switching to or using the Claude model for code suggestions. It may be related to recent updates, configuration changes, or API availability. Please investigate and restore the Claude option, or provide guidance on how to re-enable it if it's been temporarily disabled. This affects productivity for users who prefer or rely on the Claude model. Based on replies from other developers, this issue seems very likely caused by Anthropic restricting access for users in China. I haven’t seen reports of the same problem from users in other regions. Since GitHub Copilot essentially acts as a proxy to these models, I’m not sure if this limitation was requested by Anthropic, or if Copilot itself is enforcing the restriction. I also created a [post on the GitHub Copilot subreddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/GithubCopilot/comments/1nlzr5u/github_copilot_removed_claude_model_option_unfair/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button) , where many official team members are active. Hopefully more visibility can help get this issue addressed. 中文补充说明: 从目前 issue 页面的反馈来看，大概率是 Anthropic 限制了中国区用户的使用权限，因为没有看到其他地区用户提到类似的问题。GitHub Copilot 本身只是作为模型的代理，不确定是不是 Anthropic 要求 GitHub Copilot 不再向中国区用户提供 Claude 模型。 我也在 Reddit 的 GitHub Copilot 社区发了一个[帖子](https://www.reddit.com/r/GithubCopilot/comments/1nlzr5u/github_copilot_removed_claude_model_option_unfair/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button) ，希望大家能够去支持和反馈，这样更有可能引起官方的重视。 ## 更新 - 可以暂时使用VPN或代理，如果使用的是代理，需要手动在VS Code设置里面设置对应的`http.proxy` - Reddit帖子里面有一个委内瑞拉的朋友反映了这个问题，是因为美国对委内瑞拉制裁导致的。看样子，我们这边的情况也差不多，VS Code官方很可能不会出面说明这个情况。 - 虽然使用代理可以解决，但还是很气愤。很多人是冲着Claude模型去订阅的，VS Code官方在事前没有任何声明的情况下就停用了这些模型，并且截止到现在，也没有官方人员出面说明情况😡😡😡 - 指派的开发人员已经关闭了这个issue，我们理解他们开发人员确实爱莫能助。但是vs code官方应该给出补偿方案，对受此影响的用户提供额外数量的premium requests或提供通道方便用户办理退订服务。 - 本贴和reddit都有官方人员确认，他们遵从Anthropic的相关规定限制了中国区用户对Claude模型的使用。 > Hi folks, Copilot PM here. Due to an updated policy from Anthropic, we can no longer provide Anthropic models (Claude Sonnet, Claude Opus) to users in China. This change was implemented in GitHub Copilot on Friday, Sep 19. For more information about Anthropic’s regional availability, please see [their official guidance](https://www.anthropic.com/news/updating-restrictions-of-sales-to-unsupported-regions). items.title: Starting VS code takes about 15 seconds

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

labels.name: freeze-slow-crash-leak
labels.description: VS Code crashing, performance, freeze and memory leak issues

labels.name: under-discussion
labels.description: Issue is under discussion for relevance, priority, approach

items.body:
Starting vs code, even with all extensions disabled, takes about 15 seconds. I've followed the steps explained in [this article](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Performance-Issues#visual-studio-code-starts-up-slowly). Any idea why this is happening

items.title: Git command provided by copilot does not actually show the branches in the order they were created

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

items.body:
Type: Bug The command git for-each-ref --sort=creatordate refs/heads/ --format='%(refname:short)' does not display the order in which branches were created. In order to recreate the bug. Create 5 branches main -> develop -> feature/track_one -> feature/track_two -> feature/track_three Then do a pull request from feature/track_three into develop. Next do a pull request from develop into main. Then run the command and you will see that in the order always appear main, develop, feature/track_three together Extension version: 0.30.3 VS Code version: Code 1.103.2 (6f17636121051a53c88d3e605c491d22af2ba755, 2025-08-20T16:45:34.255Z) OS version: Linux x64 6.14.0-29-generic snap Modes: Remote OS version: Linux x64 6.10.14-linuxkit

items.title: Content Security Policy for webview is not working properly (only 1.104 has this issue)

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104 (only this version has an issue)
- OS Version: Windows 11

Steps to Reproduce:

I am a developer building an extension based on the Webview provided by VS Code.
In my extension, I create a Webview and render the UI on it using React.

The problem is that starting from version 1.104, the Content Security Policy (CSP) is not being applied correctly.

As shown in the screenshot below, even though I have added CSP-related settings to the <head> of the HTML used in the Webview, 

<!-- Failed to upload "image.png" -->

the Webview Developer Tools console continues to throw CSP-related errors like below. 

<!-- Failed to upload "image.png" -->

The key issue is that with the same app and the same scenario, this problem does not occur in versions prior to 1.104.

Could you let me know if there are any additional steps we need to take on our side regarding this? Or is this a bug in the latest version? A quick response would be greatly appreciated.

items.title: Claude Opus 4.1 in VS Code Copilot Chat returns “Sorry, no response”, truncates output, and still deducts from my quota
items.body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.2 - VS Code Version: 1.104.1 - OS Version: Windows 11 25H2 - Feature: ask mode - Selected model: Claude Opus 4.1 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open VS Code with GitHub Copilot Chat extension installed. 2. Sign in with a Copilot Pro+ account. 3. Select Claude Opus 4.1 from the model picker and confirm selection. 4. Enter a prompt that should return a multi‑paragraph answer. 5. Observe that the output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”. 6. Check quota usage — it decreases despite the failed response. Expected Behavior: Claude Opus 4.1 should return the full output without truncation or error, and failed responses should not consume quota. Actual Behavior: Output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”, and quota is still deducted. But Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment.

items.title: Claude Opus 4.1 in VS Code Copilot Chat returns “Sorry, no response was returned” but differs from meta issue #253126 (Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment)
items.body: This issue appears related to [#253126](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/253126) (chat-no-response) but differs in the following ways: Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment. Quota is still deducted despite the failed response. - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.2 - VS Code Version: 1.104.1 - OS Version: Windows 11 25H2 - Feature: ask mode - Selected model: Claude Opus 4.1 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open VS Code with GitHub Copilot Chat extension installed. 2. Sign in with a Copilot Pro+ account. 3. Select Claude Opus 4.1 from the model picker and confirm selection. 4. Enter a prompt that should return a multi‑paragraph answer. 5. Observe that the output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”. 6. Check quota usage — it decreases despite the failed response. Expected Behavior: Claude Opus 4.1 should return the full output without truncation or error, and failed responses should not consume quota. Actual Behavior: Output is truncated and then displays “Sorry, no response was returned”, and quota is still deducted. But Claude Sonnet 4 works fine in the same environment.

items.title: Resources opened with showTextDocument do not get disposed of when editor closed

labels.name: *question
labels.description: Issue represents a question, should be posted to StackOverflow (VS Code)

items.body:
Version: 1.102.2 (user setup)
Commit: c306e94f98122556ca081f527b466015e1bc37b0
Date: 2025-07-22T12:15:48.520Z
Electron: 35.6.0
ElectronBuildId: 11847422
Chromium: 134.0.6998.205
Node.js: 22.15.1
V8: 13.4.114.21-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

Using `window.showTextDocument(uri, options)` from an extension, files are opened correctly but when I close all editors and I reopen the file a cached version is shown instead of reopening the resource.

Is this expected?

From the docs of the method: `window.showTextDocument(uri, options)` -> _A short-hand for openTextDocument(uri).then(document => showTextDocument(document, options))._

I see that 2 references of the resource are acquired, one on `$tryOpenDocument` and another one as part of `$tryShowTextDocument`. First one is disposed of when editor is closed, but the other one held by mainThreadDocuments never gets removed. Stays there until [the auto-dispose on maxAge](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/83d5826d4df3e69ad68b01398e1a7cd9448ad4bd/src/vs/workbench/api/browser/mainThreadDocuments.ts#L35).

First reference:
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/fcd6211bb4d8e47498c092d1684b084d027744bc/src/vs/workbench/common/editor/textResourceEditorInput.ts#L169

Second reference:
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/83d5826d4df3e69ad68b01398e1a7cd9448ad4bd/src/vs/workbench/api/browser/mainThreadDocuments.ts#L286-L287

So I'm stuck with a stale version of the file till the 3 minutes pass.

I noticed this while using the [vscode-java](https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java) extension, opening class files which get decompiled and code shown on a custom editor. But I think the issue is with the showTextDocument method and not with the extension.

In my case I want to see changes on class files after rebuilding the project, but same cached version keeps being shown even after clean compile, might be related to [this ](https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/3244) issue.

items.title: Allow "Keep Changes" in the middle of an agent loop

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Often, the file changes look great to me in the middle of an agent loop, and I want to save them as a "checkpoint" so I can discard the following changes if they are incorrect. "Saving as a checkpoint" is usually done by hitting the "Keep" button, however, since the agent loop is still running, the "Keep" button is grayed out. It would be better if we allow users to keep the change anytime they want.

items.title: Need a way to support "challenges"

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: authentication
labels.description: Issues with the Authentication platform

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

labels.name: authentication-microsoft
labels.description: Issues with the Microsoft Authentication extension

items.body: On the Microsoft side, this is on the horizon: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-mandatory-multi-factor-authentication-for-azure-sign-in/ https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/concept-mandatory-multifactor-authentication?tabs=dotnet This is going to break us Sept 15th... because of these steps: * Ask for auth with scope X -> get a token * Use token at API -> it 401s with WWW-Authenticate saying it needs more claims * 🐛 we have no way to pass that down to the Microsoft auth provider, we can only have it force re-creation of a token Implementing this in a generic fashion... we could introduce a new `challenges` array to `getSession`: ```ts const challenges = // literally the array of WWW-Authenticate header values vscode.authentication.getSession('microsoft', scopes, { createIfNone: true, challenges } ``` And then in the auth provider we could make this a concrete object that contains some well-known properties like `claims`, `scopes`, etc: * https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750.html#section-3 * https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9470#name-authentication-requirements * https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9728#name-use-of-www-authenticate-for * https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc2617#section-3.2.1 while also supporting any other key. At this point the auth provider can do what it wants with that... which in Microsoft's case will pass the claims value into MSAL. #### Alternative `getSession` API Making the 2nd parameter more about influencing the shape of the token and less about the UI, we could do this: ```ts const challenges = // literally the array of WWW-Authenticate header values vscode.authentication.getSession('microsoft', { scopes, challenges }, { createIfNone: true } ``` which could then be expanded further if we want to support `resource`, another thing that would influence the token shape.

items.title: [MCP] Newly added tools not included in subsequent completion calls

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

items.body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No - VS Code Version: 1.104.0 (Insider) - OS Version: Windows 11 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create an MCP server that can update its tools dynamically. For example, the server starts with 3 tools: "greet", "calculate", and "get-status". After calling any of these tools, a new tool is added — for example, "followup". 2. Add the MCP server to your workspace. 3. Run this prompt: ``` Greet Lukasz and then do a follow-up ``` 4. Check the debug logs. On the second completion call, you’ll see that only the original 3 tools are included, even though all 4 tools were discovered. Note: The timing in the output window is UTC+2h

Double click in empty Explorer area creates a new empty file (same effect as +)
Same pattern should be followed for all views in the Chat Sessions view container. E.g. clicking on an empty space in Claude Code should just create a new claude code session.

fyi @jo-oikawa @roblourens

items.title: MCP Server results in extension always activating in all workspaces (even empty ones)

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: unreleased
labels.description: Patch has not yet been released in VS Code Insiders

items.body:
Since the latest update, the Dart extension is being activated on empty workspaces unexpectedly.

In the logs I see:

```
2025-09-11 17:30:17.502 [info] ExtensionService#_doActivateExtension Dart-Code.dart-code, startup: false, activationEvent: 'onMcpCollection:dart-sdk-mcp-servers'
```

We do have `mcpServerDefinitionProviders` listed in the `package.json` (and register an MCP server upon activation), but it doesn't make sense that we are now always activated. This seems to undermine the `activationEvents` that allows us to not be activated except for specific project types (and means that we may spawn Dart-related background processes in non-Dart workspaces).

items.title: Bad Relative Path Separator

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: workbench-tabs
labels.description: VS Code editor tab issues

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

items.body:
Hi everyone, I’ve configured a custom relative path separator (`explorer.copyRelativePathSeparator`) in VS Code settings. It works correctly when I copy a relative path from the Explorer or a normal file tab. However, when I copy a relative path from a tab that shows Git diffs of the same file (for example, when comparing changes in Source Control), the custom separator is ignored and VS Code uses the default one instead. So it seems the custom setting is not applied in diff views. Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes** - VS Code Version: Code 1.104.1 (0f0d87fa9e96c856c5212fc86db137ac0d783365, 2025-09-17T23:36:24.973Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 **Steps to Reproduce:** 1. In VS Code settings, configure a custom value for Relative Path Separator. 2. Open any file in the workspace. 3. Right-click the file tab or in the Explorer → choose Copy Relative Path → ✅ custom separator is applied. 4. Now, open the same file in a Git diff view (e.g. from Source Control or by comparing revisions). 5. Right-click the diff tab → choose Copy Relative Path. **Expected** The copied relative path should use the custom separator. `wp-content/maintenance.php` **Actual** The copied relative path ignores the custom separator and uses the default one. `wp-content\maintenance.php`

items.title: People stealing my shit
items.body:
ADD ISSUE DESCRIPTION HERE

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 18_6_2 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) CriOS/140.0.7339.122 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1

items.title: BUG: Snippet workflows are constantly sabotaged by Copilot completions, disrespecting settings AND keybindings

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: verification-needed
labels.description: Verification of issue is requested

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No, because Copilot is an extension.

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.101.2
- OS Version: Windows 11 Pro 24H2

Completions are interfering with snippets and disrespecting settings and keyboard shortcut `when` conditions that should be preventing unwanted acceptance.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In your snippets, add:

```jsonc
{
  "console.debug": { "prefix": "cdbg", "body": "console.debug(${1:`$2`$3});$0" },
}
```

2. In your editor, type `cdbg` then `tab`.

3. You'll be on the outer backticks in the snippet. A Copilot completion will likely appear almost immediately. You're now going to press `tab` to progress to the next position in the snippet.

You're iterating quickly and the completion has appeared a fraction of a second before you press `tab`, almost like it was in the bushes waiting to sabotage your attempt to use the snippet.

Having now pressed `tab`, the completion supersedes the snippet workflow, interpreting the tab as acceptance and ending the snippet workflow, rather than respecting the `editor.suggest.snippetsPreventQuickSuggestions` setting and passing the `tab` on to the snippet provider.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f96b257b-8831-464d-b353-19e9dea0880b)

This is a longstanding VSCode feature that Copilot has literally broken. It's a bug I encounter _constantly_. Like, I'm talking probably upwards of a hundred times per day.

Copilot should not be interfering with snippet workflows.

items.title: Language manual selection list highlights inexact (wrong) search result

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

labels.name: quick-pick
labels.description: Quick-pick widget issues

items.body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No - VS Code Version: 1.102.1 (system setup) - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install the "kdb" extension (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=KX.kdb) 2. Create a file named `foo` (without file name extension). Place some code in it, e.g. `f:{x+y}`. 3. Open the file in vscode. The file is probably recognized as plain text. 4. Click on the language to open Select Language Mode. 5. Type the letter `q` into the search bar. Expected result: the entry for `q` (from the "kdb" extension) is highlighted, and pressing Enter selects this language. Actual result: "MS SQL" is highlighted, and pressing Enter selects this language. However, this is an inexact match, and since the exact match only consists of a single letter, there is no way to force the highlight to move to the correct result by typing. The only way to select the correct result is clicking on it, which is slower.

items.body: error when triggering completions with `editor.suggest.preview` enabled Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open JSON file 2. enable setting `"editor.suggest.preview": true` 3. trigger completions (on a `wordPattern`) 4. error in console ```json { a } ``` ```js Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'column'): TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'column') ``` Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes - VS Code Version: v1.102 https://insiders.vscode.dev/ - OS Version: Windows 11

items.title: VS Code Copilot Recently Edited Files List Causes Performance Issues and File Restoration Problems

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

items.body:
Type: Bug ## The VS Code Copilot extension's recently edited files list (displayed above the chat box) exhibits multiple critical issues that significantly impact editor performance and cause unwanted file restoration behavior. Issues Identified: ### 1. Performance Degradation Due to Large File List Problem: - As the recently edited files list grows (reaching hundreds of files through agent mode or normal edit operations), VS Code experiences severe performance degradation Symptoms: - UI lag of 5-6 seconds during any user interaction - Delayed response to scrolling, typing, and other interface actions - Input appears to "pause" then catch up in bursts - No crashes occur, but editor becomes nearly unusable - Missing Feature: The "X" button to remove files from the recently edited-list has been removed in newer VS Code versions, preventing users from manually cleaning the list --- ### 2. Unwanted File Restoration on VS Code Restart Problem: - When VS Code is closed and reopened, deleted files that were previously in the recently edited list are automatically recreated with no content. Trigger Conditions: - Files deleted by Copilot agent - Files manually deleted by user - Files that were previously edited and appeared in the recently edited list **Only applies to files referenced in the recently modified list** Result: - Deleted files reappear in the workspace upon restart, reverting intentional file deletions --- ### 3. File State Reversion When Switching Between Chat Sessions Problem: Navigating between different chat sessions causes unwanted file system changes Behavior: - Switching to an older chat session with a different recently edited files list - Files created in newer sessions get deleted - Files that were deleted in newer sessions get restored - The file structure reverts to match the state when that specific chat session was active - Impact: Loss of recent work and confusion about current project state Expected Behavior: - Recently edited files list should not cause performance issues regardless of size - The ability to manually clear or remove items from the recently edited files list should be available - Deleted files should remain deleted across VS Code sessions - Switching between chat sessions should not modify the file system or revert file states - Each chat session should operate on the current file system state, not attempt to restore historical states --- #### Reproduction Steps - Use Copilot to edit numerous files (100+ files) through agent mode or regular editing - Observe increasing UI lag as the recently edited files list grows - Delete some files that appear in the recently edited list - Close and reopen VS Code - Observe deleted files being restored - Create new chat session, edit/create additional files - Switch back to previous chat session - Observe file system reverting to previous state - This behavior suggests the recently edited files list is incorrectly being used as a file system state checkpoint rather than simply a reference list, causing both performance and data integrity issues. --- VS Code Settings ( copilot only ) **not actual json file contents, pulled from many json settings files disregard json formatting issues in regards to this issue.** ```json "chat.agent.maxRequests": 150, "github.copilot.chat.agent.thinkingTool": true, "github.copilot.chat.completionContext.typescript.mode": "on", "github.copilot.chat.languageContext.fix.typescript.enabled": true, "github.copilot.chat.languageContext.inline.typescript.enabled": true, "github.copilot.chat.languageContext.typescript.enabled": true, "github.copilot.chat.languageContext.typescript.cacheTimeout": 2000, "editor.maxTokenizationLineLength": 50000, "chat.agentSessionsViewLocation": "showChatsMenu", "chat.checkpoints.showFileChanges": true, "github.copilot.chat.scopeSelection": true, "github.copilot.advanced": { }, "github.copilot.enable": { "*": true, "plaintext": false, "markdown": true, "scminput": false }, "github.copilot.chat.agent.autoFix": true ``` --- ### Screen grab from the list of edited files in the session I was having these issues Image with mouse on the file showing the highlife but no X, (Cursor is hidden during screenshot) --- ### Expected X button thats not there after the last VSCode update. Pre 1.101 ( Image from other bug report) --- Extension version: 0.29.1 VS Code version: Code 1.102.2 (c306e94f98122556ca081f527b466015e1bc37b0, 2025-07-22T12:15:48.520Z) OS version: Darwin arm64 24.5.0 Modes:
System Info |Item|Value| |---|---| |CPUs|Apple M1 Pro (10 x 2400)| |GPU Status|2d_canvas: enabled
canvas_oop_rasterization: enabled_on
direct_rendering_display_compositor: disabled_off_ok

multiple_raster_threads: enabled_on
opengl: enabled_on
